  1. Oxford 3000
  2. Oxford 22

Words 2101-2200

  1. quiet
    The library is a quiet place to study.

  2. quietly
    She quietly closed the door to avoid waking the baby.

  3. quit
    He decided to quit his job and travel the world.

  4. quite
    The movie was quite interesting and worth watching.

  5. quotation
    She included a famous quotation in her essay.

  6. quote
    He likes to quote lines from his favorite books.

  7. race
    The race started early in the morning.

  8. racing
    He enjoys watching car racing on weekends.

  9. radio
    She listens to music on the radio every morning.

  10. railway
    The railway connects the two major cities.

  11. rain
    The rain stopped just before the picnic began.

  12. raise
    They plan to raise money for the new school project.

  13. range
    The store offers a wide range of products.

  14. rank
    She achieved the highest rank in her class.

  15. rapid
    The rapid growth of the city surprised everyone.

  16. rapidly
    The company is expanding rapidly across the country.

  17. rare
    It is rare to see snow in this region.

  18. rarely
    He rarely goes out during the week.

  19. rate
    The unemployment rate has decreased this year.

  20. rather
    I would rather stay home than go out tonight.

  21. raw
    She prefers eating raw vegetables in her salad.

  22. reach
    We need to reach the station before the train leaves.

  23. react
    How did she react to the news?

  24. reaction
    His reaction to the surprise was priceless.

  25. read
    I like to read books in my free time.

  26. reader
    She is an avid reader of mystery novels.

  27. reading
    Reading helps improve your vocabulary.

  28. ready
    Are you ready to leave for the trip?

  29. real
    The painting looks so real that it’s hard to believe it’s not a photograph.

  30. realistic
    Her goals are realistic and achievable.

  31. reality
    The reality of the situation is hard to accept.

  32. realize
    I didn’t realize how late it was until I checked the clock.

  33. really
    I really enjoyed the concert last night.

  34. reason
    What is the reason for your decision?

  35. reasonable
    The price of the car is reasonable.

  36. recall
    I can’t recall the name of the restaurant we visited.

  37. receipt
    Please keep the receipt in case you need to return the item.

  38. receive
    Did you receive the package I sent?

  39. recent
    The recent changes in the policy were well-received.

  40. recently
    I recently started a new job.

  41. reception
    The reception at the hotel was very welcoming.

  42. recipe
    She followed the recipe to bake the cake.

  43. recognize
    I didn’t recognize him with his new haircut.

  44. recommend
    Can you recommend a good book to read?

  45. recommendation
    Her recommendation helped me choose the right course.

  46. record
    He set a new record in the 100-meter race.

  47. recording
    The recording of the concert is now available online.

  48. recover
    It took him weeks to recover from the illness.

  49. recycle
    We should recycle paper to save trees.

  50. red
    She wore a bright red dress to the party.

  51. reduce
    We need to reduce waste to protect the environment.

  52. reduction
    There has been a significant reduction in crime rates.

  53. refer
    Please refer to the manual for instructions.

  54. reference
    He included a reference to the book in his report.

  55. reflect
    The mirror can reflect light into the room.

  56. refuse1
    She refused to accept the gift.

  57. regard
    He is held in high regard by his colleagues.

  58. region
    This region is known for its beautiful landscapes.

  59. regional
    The regional office handles all local inquiries.

  60. register
    You need to register for the event online.

  61. regret
    I regret not taking the opportunity when I had the chance.

  62. regular
    He is a regular customer at the coffee shop.

  63. regularly
    She exercises regularly to stay healthy.

  64. regulation
    The new regulation will come into effect next month.

  65. reject
    They decided to reject the proposal after much discussion.

  66. relate
    Can you relate this story to your own experience?

  67. related
    These two issues are closely related.

  68. relation
    The relation between the two countries has improved.

  69. relationship
    They have a strong relationship built on trust.

  70. relative
    She visited her relatives during the holidays.

  71. relatively
    The test was relatively easy compared to the last one.

  72. relax
    Take a deep breath and relax.

  73. relaxed
    She felt relaxed after the yoga session.

  74. relaxing
    Listening to music is very relaxing.

  75. release
    The company will release a new product next month.

  76. relevant
    The information provided is not relevant to the topic.

  77. reliable
    He is a reliable person who always keeps his promises.

  78. relief
    It was a relief to hear that everyone was safe.

  79. religion
    Religion plays an important role in many cultures.

  80. religious
    She comes from a deeply religious family.

  81. rely
    You can always rely on her for help.

  82. remain
    Only a few cookies remain in the jar.

  83. remark
    His remark about the weather was quite funny.

  84. remember
    Do you remember where you put your keys?

  85. remind
    Can you remind me to call her later?

  86. remote
    They live in a remote village far from the city.

  87. remove
    Please remove your shoes before entering the house.

  88. rent
    They decided to rent an apartment near the beach.

  89. repair
    The car needs repair after the accident.

  90. repeat
    Can you repeat the question, please?

  91. repeated
    The teacher was annoyed by the repeated interruptions.

  92. replace
    We need to replace the old batteries with new ones.

  93. reply
    She didn’t reply to my email yet.

  94. report
    The report highlights the key findings of the study.

  95. reporter
    The reporter covered the story in great detail.

  96. represent
    The lawyer will represent him in court.

  97. representative
    She is the company’s representative at the conference.

  98. reputation
    The restaurant has a reputation for excellent service.

  99. request
    He made a request for additional information.

  100. require
    This job will require a lot of hard work.
